catList: This is a critical study of some of the key concepts and theories that underlie most of political theorizing in Continental Europe since 19th century.  Special emphasis will be placed on German and French traditions.  The basic aim of the course is to elucidate the historical linkages and trajectories of different strands of political thought and thus to understand the distinctive features of Continental political theory traditions.  Readings include selections from Kant, Hegel, Freud, Heidegger, and Baudrillard.
